Offering support for joining courses like DAC, DBDA, DASSD, DESD, DIOT, DITTIS.

patterns: Tell me about the courses offered?
Tell me about the specialization offered?
responses: We provide courses based on different tracks such as software development(DAC), electronics and software(DESD,DIOT,DUASP),Artificial intelligence and Data Science(DBDA), Security and blockchain(DITISS)

The full form of PG-DESD is PG Diploma In Embedded Systems and Design. The course is structured in a way to give equal emphasis to hardware and software, enabling engineers to face challenges in the design and development of state-of-the-art embedded systems. The latest curriculum includes a module on the Internet of Things (IoT), specifically focusing on IoT architectures, applications, standards, and protocols.

The full form of PG-DIOT is PG Diploma in Internet of Things. This course will enable the student to utilize various Embedded Technologies related to IoT, Sensor Networks, Communication Protocols, Cloud Computing

The full form of PG-DITTIS is PG Diploma in IT Infrastructure, Systems and Security. The objective of this course is to enable the students to understand the concepts of network security and learn the techniques of detecting the attacks and securing a network from internal and external attacks.

patterns: What happens in this 6 months of DBDA course?
Is it right decision to pursue PG-DBDA if one doesn't have a relative experience in this field?
responses: The full form of PG-DBDA is Post Graduate Diploma in Big Data Analytics. The course outcomes include big data analytics concepts, data mining, and visualization techniques. It equips students to solve real-world problems in diverse industries, hands-on experience through consulting and industrial projects, and instills expertise in advanced analytical tools.

They teach you rhe basics of Java, SQL, mongodb. Relating to big data field you also get to learn and have practical knowledge of R, Statistics with proper assignments, Python, hadoop, hive, hbase, pig, spark, advanced Java includes java with Scala, machine learning basics, Iot introduction, high performance computing basics which is only theory, business analysis, data visualization.

First of all you should be having a graduation degree in computers or IT. Secondly if you have no prior experience in the subject that is fine but you should be aware of the basic programming concepts . Fresh graduates opt for this course as well without having any relative experience in this topic but you must have the basic programming skills and also interest in the subject.

patterns: I got CDAC ACTS Pune for PG DBDA, what should I have to prepare before course?
responses: Read some basic stuff that may help you to understand things easily during course period as you will get very less time to deal with every module. 1.read DBMS and RDBMS. 2.You can install any Linux flavor and try basic commands that helps you to get familiar with Linux. 3.Do hands on with SQL and NoSQL database like MongoDB. 4.Do basic codes with Python, core Java(only core java is sufficient) 5.Read Hadoop tutorials and hadoop ecosystem basics. 6.Read stats it will help to understands r programming stuff. Note: 15 days period is sufficient to do all this with daily 4 hrs time schedule.I hope it will help.

The full form of PG-DAC is Post Graduate Diploma in Advance Computing. The main focus of this course is to enable the candidates fulfilling the eligibility criteria, to develop their skill set mainly in areas like Native and Hybrid Mobile Application Development. The course also focuses on Java Programming, as part of the industry requirement.

patterns: What courses are provided by cdac bangalore?
responses: There are many courses: 1.PGDAC - very renounced course -good for Programming nerds those who are into Coding(Subjects like : Java , c ,c++ , web programming etc). 2.PGDITISS - for those who like IT infra , Systm and IT Security/ Cybersecurity(Subjects like : Java & Java with Crypto API, PKI, Network, Network Security,Linux , DB , windows System ,Cyber Forensics etc ). 3.PG-DESD- for E&C Engg background interested in Embeded system. 4.PG-DBDA- Bigdata analytics.

patterns: Can I join the CDAC DAC course with an electrical background?
responses: To apply for these courses, applicants should hold a Bachelor's degree in Engineering (e.g., IT, Computer Science, Electronics, Telecommunications, Electrical, or Instrumentation), an MSc/MS in Computer Science, IT, or Electronics, a Bachelor's degree in any engineering field, or a Post Graduate Degree in Management with a relevant Computer Science, IT, or Computer Application background. Additionally, applicants with a Post Graduate Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, or Physics, or degrees such as MCA or MCM, are eligible. It is essential to have secured a minimum of 55% in the qualifying examination.
Yes, you can check the eligibility criteria for the course.

patterns: I want to know how the selection?
responses: The selection process consists of a C-DAC Common Admission Test (C-CAT).

patterns: I want to know when the course starts?
responses: Twice a year, in the months of September and March. Admission process will start in the months of July and December every year.

patterns: what is the duration of wbl?
What is the eligibility criteria for wbl?
What is the procedure to get an internship at CDAC?
What are the technologies offered by cdac internship?
responses: WBL is a work-based learning internship program for students who are in their final year of BE/BTech or graduates for 6 months.Work-based learning in computer science (CSE) provides students with practical, real-world experiences, allowing them to apply theoretical knowledge, develop essential skills, and collaborate with industry professionals. This hands-on approach fosters problem-solving abilities and hones technical expertise, preparing students for a successful career in the ever-evolving field of computer science.
You can apply for wbl by visiting this website:https://wblp.in/search-wbl-Opportunities-filter?org=1&city=11&state=17&tech=1
you can get all information about wbl here:https://wblp.in/

Eligibility: for wbl:Candidates (SC, ST, Women and EWS category) passed out Graduate Engineers or equivalent, M.Sc. or M.C.A. in last 2 years, with following specializations are eligible:1. B.E. or B.Tech (Computer Science, Electronics, Information Technology, Electronics and Telecommunications, Electrical Engineering and Information Technology) and engineering graduates currently in seventh and eighth semester can also apply.2. M.Sc. (Information Technology, Computer Science and Electronics)3. Master of Computer Applications
Technologies offered: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Augumented Reality/Virtual Reality,Blockchain,Wireless Networks,Smart Mobility,Health Informatics and many more

responses: Overall placement of CDAC is approx 80 percent. Some of the courses like Dac and Dbda has very good placement record.

Companies like Tech Mahindra, Amdocs, Sapiens, TIA, House of Code, etc., visited the campus. The highest salary package offered is 17 LPA, the average salary package is 7 LPA to 8 LPA, and the minimum salary package is 6 LPA. Any student who works hard will get better placement with a good package.
In these 6 months you will be trained by our best faculties.
60% is not compulsory, Each company has its own criteria for recruitment. Some companies want students with 60%. Some companies are OK with 55% or even 50%.

patterns: What is the procedure to get admission in CDAC?

Tell me about the admission process?
How to get enrolled in cdac bangalore?
responses: 1.You cancheck the admission advertising on Centre for Development of Advanced Computing website.It happens twice a year(MAY and OCTOBER).2.Apply for c-cat exam.You can apply for one or more courses,accordingly you have to pay the fee.3.Take the c-cat exam. 4. Wait for Results. 5.apply for counseling and apply for Cdac center. 6.Result will be declared for 1st counseling. 7. you have to pay the initial fee amount for the confirmation of your seats.8.Result will be declared for 2nd counseling. 9.if you have paid the fee for 1st counseling then no need to pay that amount. 10.Rest of amount you have to pay before joining date. 11.On respective date go to the CDAC center to certificate verification and formal admission in cdac.

The steps involved in the C-DAC Bangalore admission process are mentioned below:STEP 1: Application Process -Aspirants can visit the C-DAC official website to apply for the desired course. To apply for any of the accepted exams, aspirants shall do the same by visiting the respective official website. STEP 2: Selection RoundsAppear for the centre-based selection rounds and then wait for the release of their results. For Diploma courses, the C-CAT exam is accepted. STEP 3: Admission Confirmation-After the conclusion of selection rounds, shortlisted students can pay the required amount of fee to confirm their seat.
For more information contact: put_admin_contact_no

responses: The college has a dedicated and highly qualified teaching staff, with a team of experienced members. The members includes internal and external faculties who specialize in various domains of computer science and related fields. The Director of the college is Dr. Misbah sir, who has a rich academic and research background. The faculty-student ratio is maintained at a commendable 1:80, ensuring that students have easy access to personalized attention and mentorship. The faculty is highly accessible to students through regular office hours, and they are always willing to provide guidance and support in both academic and non-academic matters, creating an enriching learning environment.

patterns: how is the overall experience in cdac?
responses: The overall experience at CDAC Bangalore is enriching. It offers diverse courses in advanced computing and technology, a vibrant academic environment, state-of-the-art facilities, and expert faculty. Students benefit from hands-on training, industry collaboration, and a dynamic learning ecosystem, fostering personal and professional growth.

Students should develop a strong foundation in programming, time management, and problem-solving skills. Stay committed to regular study and practice, as CDAC demands dedication and hard work. Engage with peers and mentors, seek help when needed, and aim for a balanced approach to excel academically.

patterns: tell me the details of the CCAT exam
What is the best source and way to crack the CDAC entrance exam?
What is the c-cat exam fee?
Tell me the fees of c-cat exam
responses: CDAC CAT is a national-level exam conducted by the Centre for Development of Advanced Computing (C-DAC) to offer candidates admission to the various PG Diploma courses. The authorities conduct the exam twice a year and the duration of the exam is 1 hour and 30 minutes.

The best source is book and some website and best way is smart study.There is 3 section in C-CAT exam.Every section in C-CAT will have 50 objective-type questions. Each question will have four choices as possible answers of which only one will be correct. There will be +3 (plus three) marks for each correct answer, -1 (minus one) for each wrong answer, and 0 (zero) marks for each un-attempted question. The maximum marks a candidate can obtain in any one section of C-CAT is 150.
If the course category is 1 then the examination fees is Rs.1350 and if the course category is 2 then the examination fee is 1550.

patterns: what is the procedure for c-cat aplication?
Give details of c-cat exam application?
responses: The authorities will start the application form of CDAC C-CAT 2023 for September session on  June 6 at the official website. Candidates are advised to check the eligibility criteria first before filling out the application form. Candidates need to visit the online portal and fill in all the important details. They also have to select one of the dates on which they would like to appear for the examination. In the final step, candidates will be required to pay the online application fee through a debit or credit card.

f you wana crack CDAC entrance exam just focused on Aptitude and C language for A+B Section. Also refer Aptitude Questions and Answers for aptitude and c programming MCQ.

CCEE is the Course End Exam of CDAC, it takes place after all teaching is over. And it is an important exam because if you score well (overall and module-wise score) you will get more calls during CCPP (Common Placement)
These are basically MCQ exams conducted at the end of the course for all the modules, 14 in our case. Each module will be of 40 marks with 40 MCQs and no negative marking and time limit is 1 hour.
Exam level is medium, not so tough and isn't easy either.
